head.title: A Gaza Pullout? Give It a Chance

hedline.hl1: A Gaza Pullout? Give It a Chance

abstract.p: Stuart Pilichowski letter comments on April 13 editorial on Prime Min Ariel Sharon's proposed Israeli pullout from Gaza

block.p: You make quite evident in your April 13 editorial ''Gaza First, but Not Last'' that while President Bush speaks with President Hosni Mubarak and Prime Minister Ariel Sharon, unfortunately the Palestinians presently have no recognizable leadership with which to carry on any form of a negotiated settlement with Israel.

You make quite evident in your April 13 editorial ''Gaza First, but Not Last'' that while President Bush speaks with President Hosni Mubarak and Prime Minister Ariel Sharon, unfortunately the Palestinians presently have no recognizable leadership with which to carry on any form of a negotiated settlement with Israel.

Yet Mr. Sharon has decided that the time has come to act. He begins with what may be a painful step, but perhaps the easiest of many approaches for his country: withdrawal from Gaza. Why not allow Mr. Sharon and Israeli people the opportunity to see how this pullout plays itself out in the real world?

Will Hamas take over? Will it form an alliance with the Palestinian Authority? What role will Egypt realistically play in the daily lives of its neighbors? How will the lives of Israeli citizens be affected? Will guns and armaments for terrorists flow freely?
Only then can Israel take a levelheaded look to the future of the Jews in the West Bank.
STUART PILICHOWSKI Mevaseret Zion, Israel, April 13, 2004
